meanings.definition: The world of the dead or the underworld.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of a mysterious netherworld where spirits roam.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, the netherworld is believed to be ruled by powerful gods.
meanings.sent3: The ghost threw a party in the netherworld, inviting all the deceased.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like a dark netherworld, filled with haunting memories.
meanings.sent5: The netherworld was depicted as a shadowy realm in the ancient tales.

meanings.definition: A place or state of being that is below or beneath the earth.
meanings.sent1: Miners ventured into the netherworld of caves to search for precious minerals.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the ancient tree extended deep into the netherworld of the soil.
meanings.sent3: The lost toy ended up in the netherworld under the bed, hidden from sight.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts delved into the netherworld of possibilities lying beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: Explorers discovered a hidden passage leading to the netherworld beneath the castle.
